article_title: Siemens Continues to Carve Up Health Care
article_text:
Siemens AG Chief Executive Joe Kaeser is about to shed another part of the company’s health-care unit, while betting that the German engineering company’s future lies with its energy business.

Siemens could announce as soon as Wednesday the sale of its hearing-aid unit to private-equity firm EQT Partners, in advance of reporting its fourth-quarter and annual results on Thursday, people familiar with the matter have said. The deal, potentially valued at more than €2 billion ($2.5 billion), would be the latest sign that...

twitter.description: Siemens is expected to announce the sale of its hearing aid unit this week, as the German engineering giant continues to carve up its most consistently profitable business—health care.
twitter.creator: @ChrisAlessi
